The DVD rental exclusive has no special features. The DVD is the original theatrical version. DVD has an good anamorphic Widescreen (1.85:1) transfer and an good Dolby Digital 5.1 Surround Sound. The worst thing is Friedberg and Seltzer's script. Sometimes their jokes starts as amusing, then so-so and then unfunny. Their visual gags and as well as dialogue doesn't help at all. But at least, "Vampire Suck" is more watchable mess than "Disaster Movie". Proske has one surprisingly sexy sequence with Latner, when she tries to seduced Edward by wearing sexy lingerie (A clever reference of "Naked Gun 33 1/3:The Final Insult). Perphas the best thing about "Vampire Suck" is the end-title sequence with a music track by Marilyn Manson titled "If I Was Your Vampire" is a good touch. Otherwise, "Vampire Suck" is watchable but just don't expect much from the Friedberg and Seltzer team. (** ½/*****).

review_title: Very funny, really doesn't deserve the low votes
Pretty Much Does What It Professes To Do

review_detailed_main:
Okay. Maybe it wasn't quite that fantastic. But if you're one of those long suffering people who are mother of/lover of/husband or wife of/sibling of/father of/friend of/distant relation of/connected to a Twilight fan then you will fully appreciate this movie. To you long suffering people, Vampires Suck is probably as good (and as close to getting) as a hug from Stephanie Meyer who then goes on to beg for her devil writing before going on to promise that she will rewrite the entire series.

Yes. There are some bad jokes. There are some awful jokes! There's some moments where you'll cringe, or you might exclaim 'Oh my god!' out loud, and some where you'll laugh your head off.

The film follows Twilight and New Moon. 'Becca', Edward and Jacob are three angst ridden teenagers with love on their minds, hormones in their bodies, as they try to find true love and overcome true obstacles. Becca suspects something is strange with both Edward and Jacob. Edward and Jacob have their own problems to deal with.

This might be a parody but the creators of the film have realized something very important that Twilight fans have not yet realized- Twilight doesn't need the characters, scenes or plot changed to make it funny. It is one big joke on all on its very own. There's a few changes here and there, a few bad jokes (and good ones!), but the thing that is funniest about this film is that it IS Twilight. All actors really do a good job in this film but the three who play Bella, Edward and Jacob are stand out performers as they accurately mimic the characters of the original series.

So go see it. Have a laugh! It's therapy for you long suffering 'somehow connected to a Twilight fan' people. And if you're very badly off, I recommend you shout your Twi-fan to this film. "Hey, I heard there was a great vampire movie about misfit teenagers in love! We should go see it. I'll even pay for your ticket." Good luck. :) (And for the love of sanity; do not take it too seriously.)

review_title: Good - would watch it again sometime.
review_detailed_main:
What is it with folks who clearly do not like the Comedy/Spoof/Parody movie genre, then watch one, and write a review about how much they disliked it? I'm reminded of a comment Abraham Lincoln once made when asked about a book he was unfamiliar with, something to the effect that if that's the kind of book you like then you'll like that kind of book.

Some of the best such movies ever made are only good for a chuckle here and there and a couple of healthy laughs, and only if you are familiar with the spoofed stuff. Imagine watching the Austin Powers movies or Johnny English having never watched a James Bond film. How about seeing Galaxy Quest having never seen a Star Trek movie or TV episode. Or watching Spaceballs without having ever viewed Star Wars and Darth Vader.

If you haven't seen the Twilight trilogy then don't watch this movie; you just won't get most of it. No, this movie is not as good the those previously mentioned (which are all excellent and I would definitely watch any of them anytime), but it is good, more on the level of Epic Movie, one that I would watch again sometime.

The formula for the humor is familiar, exaggeration and opposition. If a situation seems somewhat incredible, then exaggerate it until it is silly. If a moment is supposed to be warm and touching, then make it inappropriate and uncomfortable.

This movie does a pretty good job with this kind of humor. If this is the kind of movie you like, then you'll like this kind of movie.

review_title: oh come on guys... i laughed the whole time
review_detailed_main: i honestly thought it was extremely funny. I've read all the books multiple times and seen all movies multiple times and have posters of the cast. its not a simple comedy.. its a mockery. mockery is SUPPOSED to be stupid thats why its funny i you don't think little stupid things are funny don't see it, but if you are amused by anything then you would really like it. everyone i know has liked it and the entire theater was cracking up the whole time and it was not just filled with giggly teenage girls: there were guys and adults of all ages and almost all of them were smiling and laughing. its stupid humor is not a stupid brainless humor like napoleon dynamite... its actually legit mockery.. like when u think 'oh it'd be funny if they did this!' i recommend you see it!

review_title: Acceptable spoof of the Twilight saga
review_detailed_main:
I went to see this film with a friend of mine a couple of hours ago, hoping for a good spoof if the twilight saga. Being quite a fan of the Twilight saga, having seen the films Twilight, and Twilight: New Moon (still haven't seen Eclipse).It was okay, in my opinion better than the scary movie series, epic movie, disaster movie, and the other spoofs of films the directors of this film has made.

It's quite funny to see how every character in the film is copied right off Twilight, with only minor changes in name, (some names not even changed), and the extreme over-playing of the original characters characteristics. Beccas (in Twilight Bella) expressions reminds one of the ones of Bellas in Twilight. It's not a masterpiece, but it's undoubtedly the best film if you should choose from the scary movie series, or as far as I know any other films made by James Friedberg and Aron Seltzer.

I've seen Twilight, and I knew what Vampires Sucks made fun of, but my friend, who hadn't seen any of the Twilight films also found the film entertaining. Vampires suck was is good laugh, as long as you don't expect more than that.

review_title: A shockingly underrated barrage of ridiculous hilarity
review_detailed_main:
I'm giving this movie a 10 not because it is perfect, but because it is shockingly underrated and just like probably countless fanatic Twilight Saga fans gave it a 1 just out of spite, I'm giving it a 10 partially to spite them back. If it wasn't for this shockingly underrated reception, I would've given it a minimum of 8 anyway.

This movie seriously has scenes where there is continuous, non-stop hilarity for several minutes in a row, where many people should be laughing non-stop until their stomach muscles ache.

Don't get me wrong; I'm not even a Twilight Saga hater! On the contrary, I very much enjoy watching the Twilight Saga movies, but I'm not a rabid fan either. In order to enjoy this movie, just do not expect it to overwhelm you with witty lines of humor or cute humor, no, this movie is ridiculous humor and sarcasm all the way, with the odd witty part here and there. However, the sarcasm and ridiculousness is oozing with creativity.

I honestly haven't laughed at a comedy as much (and as hard) as I laughed at Vampires Suck. If sarcastic or ridiculous humor isn't your type, or you're a completely fanatic TS fan who reveres the series like it's something sacred, then simply move on and don't rate the movie. Otherwise, if you have the faintest interest in sarcasm, and if you can understand why it is OK to laugh at something completely ridiculous, then you simply must watch this movie! =)

Most of the time when we judge a film, we rate it based on its own merits, but in the case of Vampires Suck, there are two very important prerequisites to potentially enjoying the film:

1. The viewer is familiar with the source material being parodied. In this case: the Twilight series.

2. The viewer understands parody and satire.

If you understand parody, and are familiar with the Twilight series (as in you've at least seen the movies or read the books), then this film does a wonderful job as parody of the original source material. It criticizes some of the largest weak points of the source material, without too much inane crude humor.

I have read Twilight (but avoided the films like the plague) and found the film to be quite entertaining as parody, but not as a film in it's own right. Where this movie could have really grown would have been to work more on a plot capable of standing on its own. So, I would recommend this movie, but first go pick up the Twilight books, read them and have your own critical opinion of the source material before seeing this movie.

(I can't believe that I just told people to go read Twilight...)

review_title: Not nearly as bad as everyone is saying...
review_detailed_main: Pretty much every other review says this movie is terrible, but my friends and I all thought it was hilarious! The only thing I suggest is watching the real Twilight movies if you haven't already seen them, otherwise a lot of the references wont make sense. I am the typical Twilight-hating teenager, so if you're like me you would think it's a good movie. No, the plot isn't original, but that's kind of the point of a spoof... The actress who plays Becca is PERFECT! She has all the awkward mannerisms exactly the same as Kristin Stewart. If you're the kind of person who doesn't like stupid-funny movies, then this may not be for you, but I personally thought it spoofed Twilight perfectly and it was really really funny.

I'm one of the biggest twilight fan and my friend she told me i should watch this movie so when it came out on DVD i watched it with my friend a twilight hater and i love it.

This could just be cause my friend and i are younger and there for the joke are more aimed at use but we couldn't stop laughing. I also even though i'm a twilight fan found all the joke and stabs it took at twilight and all the jokes about pop culture made my laugh so hard. Also we both agreed that Jenn Proske was a perfect mirror of Kristen Stewart and Matt Lanter was so much hotter then Robert Pattinson.

So if you are either a twilight lover or a twilight hater you will enjoy this film.

review_title: Lost sight of the fact that it was meant to be a parody but it still made me laugh
review_detailed_main:
So despite all the horrible reviews I quite liked this. I think any true 'Twilight' fan will at least appreciate it, although in saying that it did try too hard and lost sight of the fact that it was meant to be parody; essentially just remaking the first two movies down to the smallest of details including location, dialogue, similar music and even the clothing worn.

Jenn Proske as Bella/Becca does give a pretty brilliant impersonation of Kristen Stewart though, nailing her annoying ticks. And the wolf pack in their tiny shorts doing a rendition of "its raining men" really made me laugh. Jacob was probably the most entertaining character in this movie, going through his shirtless, cat chasing changes.

In the end I'm sure I've seen equal content on 'Funny Or Die' but as a (closeted) Twilight fan I did get a kick out of this. 10.13

This was probably the best one of the "spoof" movies that have been made. A more accurate title for the movie would be "A Giant Twilight Spoof". I don't care much for the series, so this movie was hilarious to me. If you really watch this movie expecting a great plot, with moments that are touching, then you are being too uptight. It's a spoof. It's made for little moments to make fun of current events that are popular. I would say that if you don't care about the Twilight series (or don't mind laughing at it) than you should see this movie. But keep in mind that it is just a spoof. Not anything extremely original.

review_title: My guilty pleasure... because I found it funny
review_detailed_main:
I don't care everyone else's hate for it... I thought this film was quite funny in places. Like when Edward Sullen is on a dare-way. Or when the werewolves are dancing to 'It's raining men'. The film is quite pretty and crisp, and the storyline isn't all that bad. If they were to ATTEMPT a sequel, I would pay good money to see it, I assure you all that.

Bella Crane (Jenn Proske) is an awkward anti-social teenager moving from the sun to the dismal town of Sporks to spend some "quality time" with her dad, Frank Crane. Whilst at her high school, she meets the beautiful Edward Sullen (Matt Lanter) an equally isolated teenager who is more than he seems.

An enjoyable laugh, perfect for beating the blues.

This movie turned out to be funnier than I expected. I laughed at least 15-20 times during the movie (:

The movie, as you can see from the title, parodies vampires and other things that are used in the entertaining industry and are fully orientated to the insecure and impressionable teenage girls and bore the other regular people to death.

I don't know why people in this site don't like spoofs, but I think some of them are really funny(especially Scary Movies) and in my opinion deserve more than the user rating given by the people here.

So I recommend you to watch the movie and if you like comedies, you gonna like it too!

review_title: It may suck but it doesn't blow.
review_detailed_main:
OK, I'm not a super fan but this is so not the 46th worst movie ever.

As someone who neither loves nor hates the Twilight Saga, I found this to be an agreeable send up of this culturally significant franchise.

A dumb movie by premise, it delivers what it promises as well as we could expect it to.

You know what these movies are like and this is one of the relatively better ones. About Date Movie standard I'd say.

review_title: Just what i expected it to be...hilarious!!!
review_detailed_main:
I personally hated every movie from the Twilight Saga and was dearly pleased when news came of a spoof of it and eagerly anticipated it. I must say I really enjoyed the Vampires Suck solely for the fact that it is a spoof of Twilight. I was pleased with the typical stereotype of vampire...burns to death in sunlight, can be killed with a stake through the heart, doesn't like garlic. But Stephenie Meyer's new fabricated vampires truly suck eggs. I mean, a vampire glittering like diamonds in the sunlight is just pathetic. Maybe Stephenie could have added that they crap out gold too.

What made the movie great was the fact that the actors portrayed their characters so perfectly. Jenn Proske as Becca was apt in Bella's shoes. I usually found Bella to have been suffering from constipation every time she said a line and Jenn was good in bring that out. Matt Lanter (screen name Edward Sullen) as Edward Cullen was equally convincing. Anyone can be Jacob as long as they have a tan and a six pack!

I personally cannot stomach another Twilight saga movie and this was the perfect antidote to the torture It would bring. As the punch line says, "From the guys who couldn't sit through another vampire movie!", I guess I am another addition to that list of guys.

To all the guys out there who truly do not like the Twilight Saga, I recommend you watch Vampires Suck and get some justice done to yourself. To all the lovers of Twilght, also Team Edward and Team Jacob and all you other wannabes, i guess you can just suck it.

review_title: Watch it with an open mind and a pure hatred towards the Twilight franchise
review_detailed_main:
Episode #4 of Lionheart490's IMDb Movie Reviews

Now I will admit that I hate Friedberg-Seltzer films, I watched Epic Movie and I thought it was just stupid. I, literally, was capable of watching Meet the Spartans for only 10 minutes on DirecTV before I changed the channel. And I'm not even going to bother to watch Date Movie or Disaster Movie. But the recent Friedberg-Seltzer film that just came out on DVD is certainly one that caught my eye. The movies that the Friedberg-Seltzer crew decided to rip-off a film series that I personally hate: the Twilight film series. Now, Twilight I feel has disgraced vampires everywhere, there was a time where vampires were scary and children couldn't sleep because they believed their blood was going to be drained from plain-skinned demons. Now, they apparently have smooth sparkly skin that fan girls just can't resist. So I believed that maybe these idiots are going to do something right and use they're sickish film-making to benefit us Twilight-haters and that is why for once, I wanted to see this Friedberg-Seltzer film. Now, when this film got into theaters, it, to me, had gotten mixed views. But I'm not going to listen to them, instead, I'm going to watch Vampires Suck with an open mind and a pure hatred towards Twilight on my mind and then, I'll tell you which sucks more: vampires or this movie?

And to my surprise, I liked it. I mean it isn't the funniest film I ever saw and I shouldn't be, but I will say this may be the best Friedberg-Seltzer film ever. I never laughed out loud but I sure had a lot of chuckles, which is more than I could say for the other Friedberg-Seltzer films. I think the reason I liked this movie is unlike the other Friedberg-Seltzer films that simply just took the main plot of a certain movie (ex: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, 300) and added it with a bunch of stupid movie references to it. This film mainly focused on the Twilight film series, they might some pop culture and film references but not enough to ruin what this film is mainly doing: mocking the Twilight franchise. The jokes aren't half-bad either, it's not laugh-your-ass-off funny, but it gave me more chuckles than I expected. For once, the FS crew actually made a spoof film, not a giant ugly wad of crappy movie references like the other films. Their references to Twilight were really funny (ex: like how nobody relies that the Sullens were vampires). I must say maybe the FS crews were getting BETTER at their jobs (AHHHHHH!!!!!)

Overall, I think this is the best FS film ever. Just watch it with an open mind and a pure hatred towards Twilight, and you'll surely enjoy it. I give this movie 6/10 stars.

review_title: Finally! The movie for us who HATE Twilight!
review_detailed_main:
Let's say it straight: I think the Twilight saga is both the most pathetic and the most brain dead teenage series. It is insult both to horror genre and the general intelligence as well. Its only excuse is that it is basically just a red book library intended for emo / metrosexual teenage generation.

The Twilight fans will hate this comedy deeply! The "Vampires Suck" comedy actually shows the naked truth about the Twilight. It does not differ much from the Twilight saga, it shows the stupidity of the original plot and makes the fun of every inch of it - from the bizarre Becca character to the both metrosexual doggie and battie clans. But the parody does not stop here - the authors do make fun from the American puritans, the celebrities and even the Twilight fans as well.

The movie is silly because the original series is silly. The Twilight series deserved this treatment so much! At least the score is settled! I had to suffer the Twilight, now I have laughed the way through its parody which was way more enjoyable. Seriously good fun!

Let me first say, I'm not a Twilight fan. But, since most of the women in my family are obsessed with it I've been forced to watch all of the Movies several times. They do suck!

Vampires Suck seemed like it would be a fun movie, parodies are a favourite of mine. It did not disappoint. Although it was supposed to be a parody the acting was actually BETTER than the acting in Twilight (not a big stretch, I know). Jenn Proske absolutely nailed the "Bella" character, right down to the silly mannerisms - I was in tears of laughter during every scene. Maybe the produces of the Twilight saga should do some recruiting?

If I had one complaint, the movie was basically a run through of the Twilight saga. I was hoping to see parodies of more Vampire movies and some other pop culture references.

review_title: Great for laughs; even for fans

review_detailed_main:
It's funny, that it is rated so low. It is one of the best spoofs. Everything that is ridiculous about this franchise is very much highlighted and exaggerated in this movie. Well maybe exaggerated too much, but hey, this is a spoof. One more brownie point about this movie, is its cast. They all look so, out of the real movie. You will be forgiven if you mistaken this movie for the real one if had a fleeting glance.

One thing I hate about the spoof genre in general is the unnecessary gore. I don't find gore funny. This movie is not so gory, but I wish it didn't have any.

All in all, this is must see movie, if you are tired of this ridiculous franchise. If your girlfriend made you sit through these movies, then this is the perfect payback for them. Enjoy!

I find myself watching this film again when come across it on my movie channel. I think Jen Proske's impersonation is excellent. The film is outrageous and violent but entertaining. Vampire movies are all violent. I suspect vampire film aficionados are offended when this genre is spoofed. The fact that there are relatively few reviews does not mean it's a bad movie. I realize the sparse reviews can mean a dud. Vampires Suck is not a great movie but I believe the movie is significantly better than its IMDb rating. I could be wrong. I notice there is not a large number of reviews. The fact that the movie is not popular speaks for itself. However it probably did not get much promotion. I notice box office income is double it's production cost. I suspect this movie did not have much promotion.

To IMDb staff: Please remove MD from my name on your site. I am a physician but I prefer to keep my movie interest separate from professional activities.

review_title: Still a better love story than Twilight
'Vamprires Suck' is a spoof, take it for what it is.

review_detailed_main: Vampires Suck is a silly parody movie that I watched in theaters at WAY to young of age because of me & my mom both being twilight fans. I was either 9 or 10 when this came out lol, I was both confused and amused by its funny changes to the original films, particularly the intensely exaggeration of certain scenes or like when they took the wold back & made Jacob a tiny little pup lmao. The film is undeniably dumb and cringey, but that's where its charm lies. From exaggerated characters to over-the-top scenarios that all parodies have, it serves up a delightful dose of absurdity and camp vibes while being still standable to find entertaing.

When I saw Twilight I got so disappointed by the actors and the movie itself that I just got totally mad every time I met any kind of news about it. It is insane how they could ruin the whole with "writing over" every single scene making it more depressive than it should be and how irritating the actors played their characters (except one or two like Alice and Emmett...) so I decided to watch the comedy version. I strongly believe if Jenn and Matt played Bella and Edward they would have done a way better performance than Kristen and Robert - sorry from the ones loving them... I could also laugh loud on the jokes and I bet the director did a better job on this - at least copied the same method which with better jokes made it more enjoyable.

I'm not gonna lie. This movie made me bust out laughing. I know, I know.... It's cheesy, It's queasy, and it's down right dumb. But man did I enjoy it. My wife made me sit through those horrible Twilight movies, so knowing that this was a spoof of the sparkly vampire teen romance garbage, I loaded the movie on one of our streaming services and made her watch without her knowing what it was about. I thought this would be my sweet revenge upon her. Much to my surprise, she thoroughly enjoyed it and was laughing harder than it was! She thought it was a great send-up of characters. Anyway, If you've seen the Twilight movies, I highly recommend (Whether you did or did not like them doesn't matter.)

So it was bad...really bad. But isn't that the point of "Spoof Movies"? Lol I had to turn Epic Movie off after like 20min because it was THAT bad...but I don't think this was THAT bad! I laughed more than I could count on my fingers and it did what it set out to do...MAKE FUN OF TWLIGHT!!!! And that, I give a 10/10.

Everyone is giving reviews as if this was supposed to be a serious movie, but it wasn't. It's a SPOOF! Chill people...

I wouldn't pay 8$ to see it again...but I would watch it online. It's worth seeing if you totally dislike Twlight like a bunch of people do (Even teens, I'm 17...).

review_title: Decent Parody Very Good Jokes Hot Actors
review_detailed_main: The original Twilight has many many problems but the vibe and music was actually not bad. (Not a fan anymore since I was 11.) Vampires Suck is absolutely hilarious and the actors are actually really hot. They captured the acting style of the original Twilight super well. The soundtrack and editing is not bad either. Worth the watch for a cheesy fun little comedy. Not a masterpiece but still decent. The other thing really nice about this one is that the pacing is so much better than the original film given that it cramped everything in two films into one. Its sequel Breaking Win is also very funny. Recommend that too if you like this one.

The movie was really funny, especially when you get all the references. The movie tries to be silly and it does that successfully and has great humor.

It also has funny 4rth walk breaks, I love 4rth wall breaks(when a character talks like he is watching the movie with us)

Minor spoiler: But towards the end, it seemed more serious with and less fun.

All in all, it is a great parody

review_title: Perfect for those who love comedy and hate Twilight

review_detailed_main:
This is not a real review, it should be taken more as a collection of impressions on the film.

Obviously a parody film of Twilight which completely nails the intrinsic stupidity of the original film, the film undoubtedly makes you laugh and perfectly follows the trend of all parody films like this. So the film is obviously not a masterpiece but it makes you laugh a lot and this is its only purpose so let's say that for its purpose it hits the target squarely. The advantage of films like this is that they are definitely not boring because they are so stupid that they make you double over laughing every second of viewing. So ultimately the film is terrible but it wants to be so on purpose and therefore it is a masterpiece.

review_title: I think these people who badly review this movie are butthurted Twilight fans
review_detailed_main: I think the people who gave this movie bad reviews are just butthurt Twilight fans who can't take a joke. Vampires Suck is a parody, and it does exactly what it promises-makes fun of the absurdity of Twilight in an over-the-top, silly way. It's not meant to be a cinematic masterpiece; it's for those who want to laugh at the ridiculousness of sparkly vampires, melodramatic love triangles, and cringe-worthy teen angst. The humor might not be for everyone-it's immature, goofy, and sometimes gross-but that's the point! If you go in expecting clever, highbrow comedy, you're in the wrong place. But if you've ever rolled your eyes at Edward's brooding or Bella's endless stares, this movie is for you. It's self-aware, ridiculous, and full of gags that hit the mark if you know the source material. Honestly, I laughed so much, especially at how they exaggerated the most ridiculous moments from Twilight. Not every joke lands, but overall, it's hilarious. 10/10!

review_title: The Worst Movie of 2010...It just sucks
